variant.question: According to the relevant medical requirements, the applicant for a Commercial Pilot Licence shall hold a current..

options.text: Class I medical assessment.
medical assessment as prescribed by the State issuing the licence.
Class III medical assessment.
Class II medical assessment.

variant.question: According to Part-MED, applicants for and holders of pilot licences are required to hold the following class of medical certificates:

options.text: Class 1 for a CPL and ATPL, and Class 2 for an MPL.
Class 1 for a CPL, MPL, and ATPL.
Class 2 for a CPL and MPL, and Class 1 for an ATPL.
Class 2 for a CPL, and Class 1 for an MPL and ATPL.

variant.question: According to EASA AIRCREW, Medical Certificates are:

options.text: Class 1 Medical Certificate, Class 2 Medical Certificate, LAPL Medical Certificate.
LAPL medical certificate, ATPL medical certificate, CPL medical certificate, IR medical certificate.
Class 1 Medical Certificate and Class 2 Medical Certificate.
Class 1 Medical Certificate, Class 2 Medical Certificate, Class 3 Medical Certificate.

variant.question: According to the relevant medical requirements, a Class 2 Medical Certificate is valid for...

options.text: 24 months until age of 40 and 12 months thereafter.
24 months until age of 40, 12 months until age of 60, and 6 months thereafter.
60 months until age of 30,24 months until age of 40, and 12 months thereafter.
60 months until age of 40, 24 months until age of 50, and 12 months thereafter.

variant.question: Who can change the limitations of class 1 medical certificate?

options.text: AeMC

| The licensing authority. |  |
| ------------------------ |  |
AME

variant.question: Your medical class 1 will expire in 10 days. If you are going to an AMC (aeromedical centre) now, you will do a medical class 1...

options.text: revalidation
extension
initial examination
renewal

variant.question: Holders of a pilot licence with privileges to fly aeroplanes or TMGs shall only tow sailplanes or banners when they:

options.text: Hold the appropriate sailplane towing or banner towing rating.
Have at least 100 hours of flight time and 200 take-offs and landings as PIC.
Hold an IR in the appropriate aircraft category.
Have at least 30 hours of flight time as PIC on aeroplanes.

variant.question: According to the relevant medical requirements, for the initial medical examination the validity of the medical assessment shall begin at the date the..

options.text: licence is issued or validated.
medical certificate is issued or validated.
licence is issued or renewed.
medical examination is performed.

variant.question: In accordance to PART-FCL, class ratings are established for Single Pilot Single Engine Aeroplanes not requiring a Type rating. These can include:

options.text: touring Motor Glider / TMG.
microlights having fixed wings and movable aerodynamic control surfaces acting in all three dimensions.
all types of single-pilot, single-engine aeroplanes fitted with a turbojet engine.
any other type of aeroplane if considered necessary.
